meanings.definition: The set of Jewish dietary laws
meanings.sent1: Following kashrut is important in Jewish tradition.
meanings.sent2: My family strictly adheres to the rules of kashrut.
meanings.sent3: When the chef accidentally mixed meat and dairy, he violated kashrut!
meanings.sent4: To him, kashrut was like a sacred code of conduct for meals.
meanings.sent5: Learning about kashrut helped me understand the significance of food in Judaism.

meanings.sent1: The restaurant proudly displayed its kashrut certification.
meanings.sent2: She checked the label to ensure the product's kashrut.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at cooking kosher ended up being a lesson in kashrut.
meanings.sent4: The kashrut of the food was a topic of discussion among the guests.
meanings.sent5: The kashrut of the meal was evident in every detail, from preparation to serving.
